answer_html: \(\mathbf{x}=s \begin{bmatrix} 1\\ 0\\ 0 \end{bmatrix} +t \begin{bmatrix} 0\\ 0\\ 1 \end{bmatrix}\) and there are an infinite number of solutions.
answer_latex:
$\mathbf{x}=s
\begin{bmatrix}
1\\
0\\
0
\end{bmatrix}
+t
\begin{bmatrix}
0\\
0\\
1
\end{bmatrix}$ and there are an infinite number of solutions.
hints_html: Recall that if the matrix has a row of zeros then the corresponding value in the augmented part of the matrix must be zero or there is no solution.
hints_latex:
Recall that if the matrix has a row of zeros then the corresponding
value in the augmented part of the matrix must be zero or there is no
solution.
hints_raw: Recall that if the matrix has a row of zeros then the corresponding value in the augmented part of the matrix must be zero or there is no solution.
question: B 04 (a)
sols_html:
Since the last two rows are zeros and the augmented part is zero we have two variables that are free parameters. Since the first row tells us that x_2=0 then we have that x_1 and x_3 are free. Therefore the two null vectors are

\[\begin{aligned} \begin{bmatrix} 1\\ 0\\ 0 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

and

\[\begin{aligned} \begin{bmatrix} 0\\ 0\\ 1 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

so therefore the solution is

\[\begin{aligned} \mathbf{x}=s \begin{bmatrix} 1\\ 0\\ 0 \end{bmatrix} +t \begin{bmatrix} 0\\ 0\\ 1 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

and there are an infinite number of solutions.
sols_raw:
Since the last two rows are zeros and the augmented part is zero we have two variables that are free parameters.  Since the first row tells us that x_2=0 then we have that x_1 and x_3 are free.  Therefore the two null vectors are

:<math>
\begin{bmatrix}
1\\
0\\
0
\end{bmatrix}
</math>

and

:<math>
\begin{bmatrix}
0\\
0\\
1
\end{bmatrix}
</math>

so therefore the solution is

:<math>
\mathbf{x}=s
\begin{bmatrix}
1\\
0\\
0
\end{bmatrix}
+t
\begin{bmatrix}
0\\
0\\
1
\end{bmatrix}
</math>

and there are an infinite number of solutions.
statement_html:
The augmented matrix below for a linear system is put in reduced row echelon form with row operations. Write one of the following:

  • the solution if it is unique

  • all solutions if there are more than one

  • state that there are no solutions.

(a)

\[\begin{aligned} \left[\begin{array}{ccc}0 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{array}\right.\left| \begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]
statement_raw:
The augmented matrix below for a linear system is put in reduced row echelon form with row operations. Write one of the following:
* the solution if it is unique
* all solutions if there are more than one
* state that there are no solutions.

'''(a)'''
:<math>
\left[\begin{array}{ccc}0 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{array}\right. \left| \begin{array}{c} 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right]
</math>
